data.title: Decent Late Night Snack
data.text: I came here after a Halloween party at Harry's. I thought that opening until 3:30am is a genius idea as it perfectly caters to drunk people who want something to eat after a night of drinking. And the idea of 2 minute pizza is pretty amazing too! I tried 4 slices from two different pizzas my friends ordered. One was the simple pizza, which was decent and plain. The other, I wasn't sure what it was , but it was good with a zang from goat and feta cheese. Not a bad meal, though not a great one either. It was an experience eating at 2:30 in the morning though!

data.title: Such an awesome place!
data.text: Such a neat place! So many toppings to choose from! Great pizza! Wish there was one in Macomb County nearby!

data.title: I wish I could rate this place higher!
data.text: I wish this place was up to standards from when it first opened. The concept of pizza being made within two minutes is unreal. Personal fast-food pizza is exactly what everybody wants. I've been lucky enough to have my food mostly turn out alright. The meals I've had have mostly been pretty tasty. That being said, a restaurant is much more than just the food it serves. The crew behind the counter is the most unprofessional crew I've ever had to deal with. The conversations they have between crew members is not only unprofessional, but very uncalled for and sometimes vulgar. Countless fights between staff leave me wondering if they even have anybody in charge. Members walking out during shift or shouting profanity at each other's mistakes, definitely wouldn't recommend bringing children here. Only thing that could save the place is the food. Surprisingly delicious food, unfortunately each crew member will portion out your toppings differently, too much, too little. Lack of training and leadership are the major problem, I believe. They have prime real estate, it would be nice if somebody took control of the place.

data.title: Neat concept
data.text: This restaurant is very unique. It is set up like a Subway, but instead it is a pizza place. You get to pick the sauces and toppings for your individual pizza. Loved it!

data.title: Best glutin free pizza!
data.text: Blaze pizza makes the best glutin free pizza!  Love the topping choices available. Fast and not pricey. My only issue with this place is they seem to have a high turnover. Young kids working the line.  They don't always know what to do so you will have to be very specific. This is my go to pizza place for glutin free!

data.title: If ir looks like a pig sty behind the counter it is.
data.text: When Blaze first opened it was great, clean quick efficient but tonight was a visit to hell. I should have known something was wrong as there were only a half dozen victims dining there. Where do I begin? It is Thursday the time 9:12PM. The topping counter looked picked over with scraps. eg only three dehydrated pieces of arugila in a steel container.  I asked for a Hawain hwever not only were they almost out of cheese they had only a paltry five or six tiny pineapple pieces so I asked for other toppings hoping to salvage this disappointment. The staff behind the counter seemed to be on drugs in that they would not make eye contact. I paid and waited, and waited and waited for the guy holding the pizza shovel to finally get off the cell phone and take out the pizza which was burnt and filthy. By filthy I know that an oven is supposed to be cleaned ever so often. By the look of the counter covered with burnt crumbs, horizontal almost empty topping bottles. No communication, nada as far as what you would like extra, only if you want it here or to go. One bite of this burnt SOS I went to return it to the zombies behind the counter where the only female told me that is the way the pizza is supposed to be. Then they asked me if I wanted a credit?  I am sure the owners are out of state probably on vacation. I could have kicked myself for staying after seeing what was happening before I placed my order. You have been warned. Enter at your own risk. The board of health needs to make a visit ASAP.

data.title: Yummy oizza
data.text: Great variety of options to choose from.  Design your own or from the suggestions on board.  Art Lovers is a standard for me.  Toppings all free so add more if you want.  Thin pizzas fire oven cooked.  Sometimes come out a little burnt.  Nice relaxed atmosphere.  Very casual.  Reasonably priced.

data.title: Used to be a favorite
data.text: Was one of our favorite places to get a quick bite to eat. Lately, the service has been poor and they are often out of certain toppings.

data.title: Favorite pizza place
data.text: Blaze has improved the quality of life for my family.  The 4 of us can NEVER agree on what to order on pizza.  Blaze saves the day.  Everyone can order exactly what they want, on their own pizza, from cheese, to meats to veggies, and sauces.  We also enjoyed watching the pizzas cook in their oven.  Best budget conscience dining experience in Royal Oak.  Don't forget to enjoy their blood orange lemonade.  Don't let the lines scare you.  It is worth the wait!

data.title: Wow! Never thought a restaurant could be so bad.
data.text:
1) Sunday 9/20/2015 - a friend of mine and I arrived at Blaze Pizza, Royal Oak MI @ 11:10am and while there were 5-6 staff members present (our presence was not acknowledged for nearly 5 minutes) while they were walking back and forth right in front of us, albeit on the other side of the serving counter. Our pizzas sat (uncooked) on the counter for another 5 minutes until it appeared the only individual who could place them in the oven casually wandered out from the back of the kitchen, but not before having a casual conversation with two other staff members first.

To be honest: the pizzas were good. But our first experience here was not great.

2) Saturday 3/26/2015 - my daughters and I arrived at Blaze Pizza, Royal Oak MI @ 11:05am. Walking in the lobby we noticed the front door was covered (I mean really bad) with greasy fingerprints, and there was a small pile of used napkins on the floor. Inside we found 3-4 staff members casually walking around while it was overly obvious that your establishment (in particular the serving area) had not been cleaned the night before. Attached please find photos. We waited roughly 5 minutes before our presence was acknowledged and we were asked to take our order. The kitchen serving area was positively discusting - pizza sauce splattered all over the counter and glass as well as drippings in the mozerella cheese, other sauces, grease and food particals contaminating ingredient trays.

I suppose what was most shocking, is that your staff was actually going to serve us - and would even consider doing so with food that was left out overnight!

Sorry to say, you have lost a first time customer who would've frequented your restaurant and recommended the same to friends/family.

data.title: Best Pizza Ever and I'm Not a Pizza Fan!!!
data.text: I'm not a huge pizza fan because I don't prefer red sauce as so many others do. My usual favorite pizza place is Tivoli's Pizza in Utica where I can get a thin crust, wood-fired pizza with pesto as a base sauce. It is wonderful and I still love it, and the location is closer to where I live in Macomb Township. The cost is higher as it is considered more of a "gourmet" pizza place.  Blaze, on the other hand, recommended by a friend is a cafeteria style, wood-fired pizza restaurant in downtown Royal Oak. My daughter and I were able to split one pizza which is under $8!! When we went to order our pizza they even let us split what we wanted on each half of the pie, so I had pesto on my half and she had red sauce on hers.  The toppings are numerous, some a little more unusual like goat cheese and spinach (both of which I ordered) Yum! I also had mozzarella, red peppers and feta. They finished it off with sea salt and oregano. It was delicious. Possibly the best pizza I've ever had! As a side note - we also split an antipasto salad. The salad was just average in my opinion. She enjoyed it more than me.

data.title: Build your own pizza - cool
data.text:
Great place which allow you to build your own pizza. I drove 30 minutes to it and it was really good dinner. 

Highly recommended

data.title: Pizza is good, employees detatched...
data.text: The pizza is pretty good here and it's nice that everybody can individually get exactly what they want.  The employees in general seem to hate their lives.  I'm unsure if I could be happy working at a place like this, but it definitely comes across in their demeanor.

data.title: "Cutting edge"
data.text: A surprise arrival, to Royal Oak. The pizzas are uniform size, and thickness. I found Myself staring at the oven.

data.title: It is Open and Delicious
data.text: Under priced at $6.95 per pizza.  We had the meat pie and the pesto; both were delicious.  You can order one of their 6 or 8 recipe pizzas or build your own - add as many toppings as you like; they make it, they cook it in under 5 minutes in the super hot oven and perfection is served.  Like pizza like me; you will love it.

data.title: Quick Casual Pizza?  And it works?
data.text:
Cool concept.  Quick made to order pizzas.  Food quality is good and it's neat to be able to customize and get your own pie at a reasonable price.  Pretty big space that's usually well maintained.

Well done blaze.

data.title: gluten free goodness
data.text:
I've suffered through many a terrible pizza since going gluten free, but my dinner at Blaze was not one of them. The GF crust is pressed out to order by someone wearing a clean pair of gloves, and is placed on a baking sheet to help keep cross contamination down.

You pick your own sauce and toppings, as many as you like for one decent price. I opted for the traditional red sauce and really liked it. The baking time is pretty quick, so the wait was much less than other sit-down pizza places. GF crust was pretty thin, but I liked that better than the gummy/undercooked crusts I've had elsewhere.

The rest of my group was enjoyed their traditional crusts, and especially the part where we didn't have to come to a consensus on toppings. Great place to go with a crowd... or by yourself, since they have special half-pizza-sized takeout boxes.

data.title: cold carry out
data.text: Pizza was flavorful, but pick up for carry out was hectic, and it was cold 3 minutes later when got home.

data.title: Great all the way!
data.text: What a treat to find tasty and creative pizza at a great price and prepared quickly by upbeat staff!  This place is a treasure!  It is indeed similar to a Chipotle type of restaurant in that clients arrive at a counter where they have the option to choose from a VERY large assortment of toppings that are placed on their pizza as they watch. I loved it and can't wait to find a reason to travel back to Royal Oak with more friends to turn them on to this restaurant!  TRY IT!!!!

data.title: Very cool idea
data.text: This is like the Chipotle of pizza places.  You get to custom make your pizza with any ingredients that you want and then they cook it in minutes.  The prices were very reasonable and the food was delicious.
